answers.text: Customers can run enough instances to handle peak workloads.
EC2 instances can be launched on-demand to correspond to varying workloads.
EC2 instances can be pre-paid for higher savings.
Customers can acquire different EC2 instances including dedicated hosts.
If workloads can be terminated and resumed, buying spot instances can result in even greater savings.

text: In what ways can AWS be more economical than traditional data centers for compute workloads?
